titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Williams C. Wooldridge papers, ca. 1960-2015
titlestmt.subtitle: Wooldridge, William C., papers, ca. 1960-2015 51624

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid derived from MARC record by Trenton Hizer, 1 December 2015

titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Williams C. Wooldridge papers, ca. 1960-2015
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 51624

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William C. Wooldridge papers, ca. 1960-2015. Accession 51624. Personal papers collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of William C. Wooldridge of Suffolk, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1960-2015, of William C. Wooldridge of Suffolk, Virginia, consisting of articles, Bible records, books, brochures, census records, correspondence, court records, death records, deeds, ephemera, genealogical notes, interviews, marriage records, military records, obituaries, pamphlets, photographs, wills, and other papers compiled by Laurence B. Gardiner (1906-1994) and Wooldridge chronicling the genealogy of the descendants of John Wooldridge (ca. 1678-1757) of Henrico and Chesterfield Counties, Virginia. Collection includes books written by various members of the Wooldridge family on various topics, including William C. Wooldridge's THE WOOLDRIDGE FAMILY (2 volumes), and ephemera relating to members of the Wooldridge family and their business interests.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aid
otherfindaid.p: Consult both the on-line finding aid and the hard copy finding aid located in the first folder in the first box of the collection.

scopecontent.p: John[2] contains papers on the descendants of John Wooldridge (ca. 1705-1783), son of John Wooldridge (ca. 1678-1757).

scopecontent.p: Appendices contain papers containing information on families named Wooldridge, but not related to the John Wooldridge (ca. 1678-1757) family. Also includes information on families named Waldridge, Wilrich,Wollage, Woolrich, and Woolrick.

did.unittitle: Appendix A: Northumberland VA; St. Mary's MD; Norfolk VA; Piedmont and Eastern NC; Eastern Shore Valley of VA (folder 3 of 3).
Appendix A: Northumberland VA; St. Mary's MD; Norfolk VA; Piedmont and Eastern NC; Eastern Shore Valley of VA (folder 3 of 3).
Appendix A: Northumberland VA; St. Mary's MD; Norfolk VA; Piedmont and Eastern NC; Eastern Shore Valley of VA (folder 3 of 3).
Appendix B: Wollage and Waldridge of Culpeper; Garrard Co. KY; Nicholas Co., WV.
Appendix C: MA, NY, WI, Pacific Coast.
Appendix F: Descendants of James Wooldridge, Canada, ND, MT.
Appendix G: German origin Wilrch, Woolrick, Woolrich of NJ, MD, Southwest VA, IL.

scopecontent.p: Geographic/Subject files containing information on the Wooldridge and related families by geographic location. Includes files containing information on African American families named Wooldridge, DNA information, and Wooldridges (and related names) in the military.

did.unittitle: Wisconsin (also see Appendix C: MA, NY, WI).

scopecontent.p: Books and ephemera contain books written by members of the Wooldridge family, including William C. Wooldridge's The Wooldridge Family (2 volumes) which is based on this collection, as well as ephemera collected by William C. Wooldridge relating to members of the family.

did.unittitle: The Wooldridge Family (2 volumes) by William C. Wooldridge.
The Descendants of Josiah and Keziah Nichols Wooldridge by Wright W. Frost (see file 180).
The Wooldridge Family Who's Who in America edited by Ellen Weiner, senior editor (no file).
The Devil and the Grafter by Clifton R. Wooldridge (see file 814).
The Grafters of America by Clifton R. Wooldridge (see file 814).
Hands Up! In the World of Crime (two copies) by Clifton R. Wooldridge (see file 814.
20 Years a Detective by Clifton R. Wooldridge (see file 814).
Hannah's Brave Year by Rhoda Wooldridge (see file 555).
Hannah's Flood by Rhoda Wooldridge (see file 555).
Hannah's House by Rhoda Wooldridge (see file 555).
That's the Way, Joshuway by Rhoda Wooldridge (see file 555).
History of the Sacramento Valley, California (3 volumes) by Jesse Walton Wooldridge (see file 698).
Some Watkins Families of Virginia and Their Kin by John Hale Stutesman (see file 14).
Edgewood: the Story of a Family and Their House by James Wooldridge Powell (see file 81).
Recipes and Remembrances: the Wooldridge Family Cookbook see genealogy notes at pages 3-5 and family pictures throughout (see file 292).
Alexander Penn Wooldridge by Ruth Ann Overbeck (see file 532).
The Rogue: A River to Run by Florence Arman with Glen Wooldridge (see file 575).
The Giants of the Marne: A Story of McAlexander and His Regiment (3 copies) by Jesse Walton Wooldridge (see file 698).
Timely...Timeless by Jesse Walton Wooldridge (see file 698).
Chapple, Wooldridge and Allied Families by Walter S. Finley in Americana volume 24, number 1 (January 1930) (see file Appendix E).
Eye of the Eagle: The Outdoor Photography of Don Wooldridge text by Bill Nunn (see file Appendix E).
Perfecting the Earth by C. W. Wooldridge (see file Appendix E).
Wooldridge Jellico mine tokens, ca. 1896 (see file 317.Powhatan--317.iii.James Richard Washington Wooldridge).

Small clear glass bottle with metal cap, 3 1.2 inches high, with raised glass lettering The Robt. A. Wooldridge Company Baltimore, Md. (see file 392.Joseph R. Wooldridge--392.iii.Robert A. Wooldridge).
Wooden domino box with sliding wood lid, with lettering for the Wooldridge Fertilizer Company (see file 392.Joseph R. Wooldridge--392.iii.Robert A. Wooldridge).
Dominoes (including ones in domino box), with lettering for the Wooldridge Fertilizer Company (see file 392.Joseph R. Wooldridge--392.iii.Robert A. Wooldridge).

Two circular pin holders, comprised of two metal disks sandwiching a thin layer of cork, with lettering for R. A. Wooldridge and Co. Natural Guanos (see file 392.Joseph R. Wooldridge--392.iii.Robert A. Wooldridge).

Metal case with two openings, one for stamps and one for matches, with strike plate on back and lettering for The Wooldridge Fertilizer Co. on front (see file 392.Joseph R. Wooldridge--392.iii.Robert A. Wooldridge).
Folding wooden measuring stick with lettering for The Wooldridge Fertilizer Company (see file 392.Joseph R. Wooldridge--392.iii.Robert A. Wooldridge).

Octagonal dark amber necked medicine bottle, 8 1/4 inches high, with raised glass lettering W.W.C. on the four shourt sides of the octagon, and on one wide side raised glass lettering Wooldridge Wonderful Cure Co. Columbus [Georgia] (see file 554.Thomas F. Wooldridge--554.vii.Dr. Jordan H. Wooldridge).
